sen.j: 舞鶴湾（まいづるわん）は、京都府舞鶴市の海岸の地形を形成する湾。
sen.e: Maizuru bay constitutes the features of the coastal geography in Maizuru City Kyoto Prefecture.
Maizuru bay constitutes the features of the coastal geography in Maizuru City Kyoto Prefecture.
Maizuru bay constitutes the features of the coastal geography in Maizuru City Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 若狭湾の南西部にあり、支湾となっている。
sen.e: It is located south east of Wakasa Bay, being a branch bay of Wakasa Bay.
It is located south east of Wakasa Bay, being a branch of Wakasa Bay.
It is located south west of Wakasa Bay, being a branch of Wakasa Bay.
sen.cmt: 南西部 としました。

sen.j: 湾奥には大きく二つに分かれ、舞鶴東港と舞鶴西港がある。
sen.e: The inner part of the bay is largely divided in to two parts; Maizuru Higashi Port, Maizuru East Port and Maizuru Nishi Port, Maizuru West Port
The inner part of the bay is largely divided in to two parts; Maizuru Higashi Port, Maizuru East Port and Maizuru Nishi Port, Maizuru West Port
The inner part of the bay is largely divided in to two parts; Maizuru Higashi Port (Maizuru East Port) and Maizuru Nishi Port (Maizuru West Port).
sen.cmt: カッコ内に入れました。

sen.e: Maizuru bay in English
Maizuru bay in English
Maizuru bay in English

sen.j: 舞鶴湾は若狭湾の一部をなし、湾口が北北東の方向を向いたY字の形状をしている。
sen.e: Maizuru bay comprises Wakasa Bay and its mouth is Y-shaped orienting north-northeast.
Maizuru bay comprises Wakasa Bay and its mouth is Y-shaped oriented north-northeast.
Maizuru bay comprises Wakasa Bay and its mouth is Y-shaped oriented north-northeast.
The mouth is narrow with a width of only about 700 meters.
The mouth is narrow with a width of only about 700 meters.
The mouth is narrow with a width of only about 700 meters.

sen.j: そのため、湾内は極めて静穏であるほか、湾内の干満差が最大でも30cmと極めて小さい。
sen.e: This is because the inside of the bay is very calm and quiet with extremely a small tidal range not higher than 30 cm.
This is because the inside of the bay is very calm and quiet with an extremely small tidal range not higher than 30 cm.
Therefore the inside of the bay is very calm and quiet with an extremely small tidal range not higher than 30 cm.

sen.j: 平均水深20mで、また四方を300～400m級の山で囲まれていることから、強風や荒天を避けることができ、良港としての条件を備えている。
sen.e: The bay with an average depth is 20 cm meets requirement for a good port because 300- to 400-meter-high mountains surrounding the bay can block strong winds and stormy weather.
The bay has an average depth of 20 m, meeting requirements for a suitable port due to the 300- to 400-meter-high mountains surrounding the bay, which block strong winds and stormy weather.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow, incorrect information etc
sen.e: The bay has an average depth of twenty meters, meeting requirements for a suitable port due to the 300- to 400-meter-high mountains surrounding the bay, which block strong winds and stormy weather.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: また日本海から湾内を目視する事ができないため、軍事上の拠点として重要視された。
sen.e: It was also regarded as important as a military base because its inside can not be seen from the Japan Sea.
It was also regarded as important as a military base because its insides could not be seen from the Japan Sea.
It was also regarded as important as a military base because its insides could not be seen from the Japan Sea.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）10月1日には舞鶴鎮守府が開庁されている。
sen.e: Maizuru Chinju-fu, Maizuru army base, Maizuru navy base was established on October 1, 1901.
Maizuru Chinju-fu, Maizuru army base, Maizuru navy base was established on October 1, 1901.
Maizuru Chinju-fu (Maizuru navy base) was established on October 1, 1901.
sen.cmt: 舞鶴鎮守府→Maizuru Chinju-fu (Maizuru navy base) としました。

sen.j: 戦後は大陸からの引揚げの拠点となり、平桟橋には13年にわたって約66万人の人々が祖国への帰還を果たした。
sen.e: After World War Two it was a repatriation port for returnee from the Chinese continent; about 660 thousand people returned home at Taira-sanbashi Bridge over 13 years.
After World War Two it was a repatriation port for returnees from the Chinese continent; about 660 thousand people returned home at Taira-sanbashi Bridge over 13 years.
After World War Two it was a repatriation port for returnees from the Chinese continent; about 660 thousand people returned home at Taira-sanbashi Bridge over thirteen years.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: その頃の岸壁の母は有名。
sen.e: There is a famous story of Gampeki no haha, or mothers who were waiting for their sons to come back from war.
There is a famous story of Gampeki no haha, or mothers who were waiting for their sons to come back from war.
There is a famous story of Ganpeki no haha, or mothers who were waiting for their sons to come back from war.

sen.j: また近年では舞鶴市の観光事業として舞鶴湾のリアス式海岸の景色の美しさを積極的にPRしている。
sen.e: In recent years, Maizuru City has actively appealed Maizuru Port's scenic beauty formed by its ria coast.
In recent years, Maizuru City has actively appealed Maizuru Port's scenic beauty formed by its ria coast.
In recent years, Maizuru City has actively appealed Maizuru Port's scenic beauty formed by its ria coast.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）に開業した五老岳スカイタワーからの舞鶴湾の絶景は近畿百景第1位にも選ばれた。
sen.e: The superb view afforded by Gorogadake Sky Tower, which opened in 1995, was selected as 100 Most Beautiful Scenery of Knki.
The superb view afforded by Gorogadake Sky Tower, which opened in 1995, was selected to be included in the 100 Most Beautiful Scenes of Kinki.
The superb view afforded by Gorogadake Sky Tower, which opened in 1995, was selected to be included in the 100 Most Beautiful Scenes of Kinki region.

sen.j: 湾口の東側が博奕岬、西側が金ヶ岬である。
sen.e: Bakuchi Misaki Cape is east of the mouth of the bay; Kanagamisaki Cape is west of it.
Bakuchi Misaki Cape is east of the mouth of the bay; Kanagamisaki Cape is west of it.
Bakuchi Misaki Cape is east of the mouth of the bay; Kanagamisaki Cape is west of it.
